header.title: The Navigation Framework
header.abstract: Proposal for a standard navigation framework.

section.title: Introduction
section.p: To goal of the navigation framework is to

ul.li: simplify and standardize the generation of navigation widgets like menubars, tabs, breadcrumb paths.

section.p: With the approach that is presented here it shall be possible to

ul.li: use pre-defined XHTML navigation components and present them with a custom CSS,
override these components in a publication whereby the logic can be reused, and
create and integrate new publication-specific navigation components using the same scheme.

section.title: Architecture
section.p: The navigation framework consists of the following components:

dl.dd: The sitemap where the navigation components are loaded.
The default navigation components that are shipped with Lenya.
Custom navigation components of the publication.

section.title: Loading a Navigation Component
section.p: You can load a navigation component from the following URI:

dl.dd: The navigation component to load (tabs, menu, etc.).
The navigation path. It is a concatenation of the href attributes of the sitetree nodes that lead to the current node, e.g. demo/oscom.html for the sitetree fragment

section.title: Aggregating the Navigation Components
section.p: The basic principle is shown in the following figure:
In the publication sitemap (lenya/pubs/<pub-id>/sitemap.xmap) the navigation components are aggregated. Here you decide which components you want to use:
section.source:
<map:pipeline> <map:match pattern="navigation/**.html"> (1) <map:aggregate element="page" prefix="page" ns="http://apache.org/cocoon/lenya/cms-page/1.0">
(2) <map:part src="cocoon://navigation/ {publication-id}/breadcrumb/{../1}.html.xml"/>
(3) <map:part src="cocoon://navigation/ {publication-id}/tabs/{../1}.html.xml"/>
(4) <map:part src="cocoon://navigation/ {publication-id}/menu/{../1}.html.xml"/>
</map:aggregate>
(5) <map:transform src="xslt/page2xhtml.xsl"> (6) <map:parameter name="root" value="{context}/{publication-id}/"/> </map:transform>
(7) <map:serialize type="xhtml"/>
</map:match> </map:pipeline>

ol.li: The navigation elements are aggregated together with other document parts.
The stylesheet can use this parameter to generate absolute URLs.
Finally, serialize the page as XHTML.

section.title: Developing Navigation Components
section.p: The following contracts define the development of navigation components:

ul.li:
A navigation component is an XSLT stylesheet that is located at
lenya/xslt/navigation/<component>.xsl for default components and
lenya/pubs/<publication-id>/lenya/xslt/<component>.xsl for default components.
The default components produce an XHTML fragment with the top level element <div class="<component>"/>.
